Hesperidin is a major flavonoid compound, present in orange and lemon fruits. 470–761 mg/L of Hesperidin is normally present in orange juice
31 . This phytochemical exhibit various medicinal properties. According to oral toxicity study of hesperidin, it can be concluded that this phytochemical can be safely used in herbal formulations with its LD 50 value more than 2000 mg/kg
31 . This flavanone glycoside, has a long medicinal history in both Indian and Chinese herbal medications
32 . This phytochemical alone or in combination with other chemicals, is often used to treat various diseases.
